Accessibility services helps app read content on the screen in this case accessibility permission is required to read text on screen and on other apps. On the settings, select this app and enable accessibility permission
When using this tool a hovering widget displayed over other apps. Please grant permission to draw over other apps
PharaSnap can help you copy text on the screen even on places where you cannot directly copy text

To make this tool easily accessible to use add the quick shortcut in your notification panel. Open your notification panel, in the top section you can edit action shortcut and add the app shortcut with title "Capture Text" \n\nAnother way to open the widget is by long pressing the app launch icon which prompt you open the widget.

When capturing text there are two modes, 
1. Normal mode where you simply tap on text element on screen to capture. 
2. Image mode uses text recognition OCR (for now only support latin characters) to capture text on images. 
When switching to Image mode the app request screen capture in order to visually see the image on the screen. Screen capturing would automatically turn off after few seconds if you leave Image mode 

You can toggle between the two modes on left-most button on the widget.

Once you tap on the text on screen (not dragging) it would get highlighted and copied to clipboard. You can optionally change the text selection which copied.\nYou can also view your last 20 copied item in recent list.
